trans-unit.source: Usage analysis with Application Insights
trans-unit.target: Usage analysis with Application Insights

trans-unit.source: Overview of usage analytics with Application Insights
trans-unit.target: Overview of usage analytics with Application Insights

trans-unit.source: Usage analysis with Application Insights
trans-unit.target: Usage analysis with Application Insights

trans-unit.source: Knowing how people use your application lets you focus your development work on the scenarios that are most important to them, and gain insights into the goals that they find easier or more difficult to achieve.
trans-unit.target: Knowing how people use your application lets you focus your development work on the scenarios that are most important to them, and gain insights into the goals that they find easier or more difficult to achieve.

trans-unit.source: Application Insights can provide a clear view of your application's usage, helping you to improve your users' experience, and meet your business goals.
trans-unit.target: Application Insights can provide a clear view of your application's usage, helping you to improve your users' experience, and meet your business goals.

trans-unit.source: Application Insights works for both stand-alone apps (on iOS, Android and Windows) and for web apps (hosted on .NET or J2EE).
trans-unit.target: Application Insights works for both stand-alone apps (on iOS, Android and Windows) and for web apps (hosted on .NET or J2EE).

trans-unit.source: Add Application Insights to your project
trans-unit.target: Add Application Insights to your project

trans-unit.source: To get started, get a subscription to [Microsoft Azure](https://azure.com).
trans-unit.target: To get started, get a subscription to [Microsoft Azure](https://azure.com).

trans-unit.source: (There's a free trial, and after the trial period, you can continue with the free tier of the service.)
trans-unit.target: (There's a free trial, and after the trial period, you can continue with the free tier of the service.)

trans-unit.source: In the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com), create an Application Insights resource.
trans-unit.target: In the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com), create an Application Insights resource.

trans-unit.source: This is where you'll see usage and performance data about your app.
trans-unit.target: This is where you'll see usage and performance data about your app.

trans-unit.source: In Azure, click New, Developer Services, Application Insights
trans-unit.target: In Azure, click New, Developer Services, Application Insights

trans-unit.source: **If your app is a device app,** add the Application Insights SDK to your project.
trans-unit.target: **If your app is a device app,** add the Application Insights SDK to your project.

trans-unit.source: The exact procedure varies depending on your [IDE and platform](app-insights-platforms.md).
trans-unit.target: The exact procedure varies depending on your [IDE and platform](app-insights-platforms.md).

trans-unit.source: For Windows apps, just right-click the project in Visual Studio and choose "Add Application Insights."
trans-unit.target: For Windows apps, just right-click the project in Visual Studio and choose "Add Application Insights."

trans-unit.source: **If it's a web app,** open the Quick Start blade and get the code snippet to add to your web pages.
trans-unit.target: **If it's a web app,** open the Quick Start blade and get the code snippet to add to your web pages.

trans-unit.source: Republish them with this snippet.
trans-unit.target: Republish them with this snippet.

trans-unit.source: Open Quick start and click Get code to monitor my web pages.
trans-unit.target: Open Quick start and click Get code to monitor my web pages.

trans-unit.source: Copy the script into the head of your master web page.
trans-unit.target: Copy the script into the head of your master web page.

trans-unit.source: You can also add Application Insights to your [ASP.NET](app-insights-start-monitoring-app-health-usage.md) or [J2EE](app-insights-java-get-started.md) server code so as to combine telemetry from both client and server.
trans-unit.target: You can also add Application Insights to your [ASP.NET](app-insights-start-monitoring-app-health-usage.md) or [J2EE](app-insights-java-get-started.md) server code so as to combine telemetry from both client and server.

trans-unit.source: Run your project and see first results
trans-unit.target: Run your project and see first results

trans-unit.source: Run your project in debug mode for a few minutes, and then go to the [Azure portal](http://portal.azure.com) and browse to your project resource in Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: Run your project in debug mode for a few minutes, and then go to the [Azure portal](http://portal.azure.com) and browse to your project resource in Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: In Azure, click Browse, Application Insights, and select your project
trans-unit.target: In Azure, click Browse, Application Insights, and select your project

trans-unit.source: Publish your app to get more telemetry and find out what your users are doing with your app.
trans-unit.target: Publish your app to get more telemetry and find out what your users are doing with your app.

trans-unit.source: Analytics out of the box
trans-unit.target: Analytics out of the box

trans-unit.source: Click the Page Views tile to see usage details.
trans-unit.target: Click the Page Views tile to see usage details.

trans-unit.source: In Azure, Browse > Application Insights > your project and scroll down to the Page Views tile
trans-unit.target: In Azure, Browse > Application Insights > your project and scroll down to the Page Views tile

trans-unit.source: Hover in the blank part above a graph to see the counts at a particular point.
trans-unit.target: Hover in the blank part above a graph to see the counts at a particular point.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, the numbers show the value aggregated over the period, such as an average, a total, or a count of distinct users over the period.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, the numbers show the value aggregated over the period, such as an average, a total, or a count of distinct users over the period.

trans-unit.source: In web applications, users are counted by using cookies.
trans-unit.target: In web applications, users are counted by using cookies.

trans-unit.source: A person who uses several browsers, clears cookies, or uses the privacy feature will be counted several times.
trans-unit.target: A person who uses several browsers, clears cookies, or uses the privacy feature will be counted several times.

trans-unit.source: A web session is counted after 30 minutes of inactivity.
trans-unit.target: A web session is counted after 30 minutes of inactivity.

trans-unit.source: A session on a phone or other device is counted when the app is suspended for more than a few seconds.
trans-unit.target: A session on a phone or other device is counted when the app is suspended for more than a few seconds.

trans-unit.source: Click through any chart to see more detail.
trans-unit.target: Click through any chart to see more detail.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: On the overview blade, click the Sessions chart
trans-unit.target: On the overview blade, click the Sessions chart

trans-unit.source: (This example is from a website, but the charts look similar for apps that run on devices.)
trans-unit.target: (This example is from a website, but the charts look similar for apps that run on devices.)

trans-unit.source: Compare with the previous week to see if things are changing:
trans-unit.target: Compare with the previous week to see if things are changing:

trans-unit.source: Select a chart that shows a single metric, switch on Prior Week
trans-unit.target: Select a chart that shows a single metric, switch on Prior Week

trans-unit.source: Compare two metrics, for example users and new users:
trans-unit.target: Compare two metrics, for example users and new users:

trans-unit.source: Select a chart, search for and check or uncheck metrics.
trans-unit.target: Select a chart, search for and check or uncheck metrics.

trans-unit.source: Group (segment) data by a property such as Browser, Operating System, or City:
trans-unit.target: Group (segment) data by a property such as Browser, Operating System, or City:

trans-unit.source: Select a chart that shows a single metric, switch on Grouping, and choose a property
trans-unit.target: Select a chart that shows a single metric, switch on Grouping, and choose a property

trans-unit.source: Page usage
trans-unit.target: Page usage

trans-unit.source: Click the page views tile to get a a breakdown of your most popular pages:
trans-unit.target: Click the page views tile to get a a breakdown of your most popular pages:

trans-unit.source: From the Overview blade, click the Page views chart
trans-unit.target: From the Overview blade, click the Page views chart

trans-unit.source: The example above is from a games website.
trans-unit.target: The example above is from a games website.

trans-unit.source: From it we can instantly see:
trans-unit.target: From it we can instantly see:

trans-unit.source: Usage hasn't improved in the past week.
trans-unit.target: Usage hasn't improved in the past week.

trans-unit.source: Maybe we should think about search engine optimization?
trans-unit.target: Maybe we should think about search engine optimization?

trans-unit.source: Many fewer people see the games pages than the Home page.
trans-unit.target: Many fewer people see the games pages than the Home page.

trans-unit.source: Why doesn't our Home page attract people to play games?
trans-unit.target: Why doesn't our Home page attract people to play games?

trans-unit.source: 'Crossword' is the most popular game.
trans-unit.target: 'Crossword' is the most popular game.

trans-unit.source: We should give priority to new ideas and improvements there.
trans-unit.target: We should give priority to new ideas and improvements there.

trans-unit.source: Custom tracking
trans-unit.target: Custom tracking

trans-unit.source: Let's suppose that instead of implementing each game in a separate web page, you decide to refactor them all into the same single-page app, with most of the functionality coded as Javascript in the web page.
trans-unit.target: Let's suppose that instead of implementing each game in a separate web page, you decide to refactor them all into the same single-page app, with most of the functionality coded as Javascript in the web page.

trans-unit.source: This allows the user to switch quickly between one game and another, or even have several games on one page.
trans-unit.target: This allows the user to switch quickly between one game and another, or even have several games on one page.

trans-unit.source: But you'd still like Application Insights to log the number of times each game is opened, in exactly the same way as when they were on separate web pages.
trans-unit.target: But you'd still like Application Insights to log the number of times each game is opened, in exactly the same way as when they were on separate web pages.

trans-unit.source: That's easy: just insert a call to the telemetry module into your JavaScript where you want to record that a new 'page' has opened:
trans-unit.target: That's easy: just insert a call to the telemetry module into your JavaScript where you want to record that a new 'page' has opened:

trans-unit.source: Custom events
trans-unit.target: Custom events

trans-unit.source: You can use telemetry in many ways to understand how your application is being used.
trans-unit.target: You can use telemetry in many ways to understand how your application is being used.

trans-unit.source: But you don't always want to mix the messages up with page views.
trans-unit.target: But you don't always want to mix the messages up with page views.

trans-unit.source: Instead, use custom events.
trans-unit.target: Instead, use custom events.

trans-unit.source: You can send them from device apps, web pages or a web server:
trans-unit.target: You can send them from device apps, web pages or a web server:

trans-unit.source: (JavaScript)
trans-unit.target: (JavaScript)

trans-unit.source: (VB)
trans-unit.target: (VB)

trans-unit.source: The most frequent custom events are listed on the overview blade.
trans-unit.target: The most frequent custom events are listed on the overview blade.

trans-unit.source: On the Overview blade, scroll down to and click Custom Events.
trans-unit.target: On the Overview blade, scroll down to and click Custom Events.

trans-unit.source: Click the head of the table to see total numbers of events.
trans-unit.target: Click the head of the table to see total numbers of events.

trans-unit.source: You can segment the chart by various attributes such as the event name:
trans-unit.target: You can segment the chart by various attributes such as the event name:

trans-unit.source: Select a chart that shows just one metric.
trans-unit.target: Select a chart that shows just one metric.

trans-unit.source: Switch on Grouping.
trans-unit.target: Switch on Grouping.

trans-unit.source: Choose a property.
trans-unit.target: Choose a property.

trans-unit.source: Not all properties are available.
trans-unit.target: Not all properties are available.

trans-unit.source: The particularly useful feature of timelines is that you can correlate changes with other metrics and events.
trans-unit.target: The particularly useful feature of timelines is that you can correlate changes with other metrics and events.

trans-unit.source: For example, at times when more games are played, you'd expect to see a rise in abandoned games as well.
trans-unit.target: For example, at times when more games are played, you'd expect to see a rise in abandoned games as well.

trans-unit.source: But the rise in abandoned games is disproportionate, you'd want to find out whether the high load is causing problems that users find unacceptable.
trans-unit.target: But the rise in abandoned games is disproportionate, you'd want to find out whether the high load is causing problems that users find unacceptable.

trans-unit.source: Drill into specific events
trans-unit.target: Drill into specific events

trans-unit.source: To get a better understanding of how a typical session goes, you might want to focus on a specific user session that contains a particular type of event.
trans-unit.target: To get a better understanding of how a typical session goes, you might want to focus on a specific user session that contains a particular type of event.

trans-unit.source: In this example, we coded a custom event "NoGame" that is called if the user logs out without actually starting a game.
trans-unit.target: In this example, we coded a custom event "NoGame" that is called if the user logs out without actually starting a game.

trans-unit.source: Why would a user do that?
trans-unit.target: Why would a user do that?

trans-unit.source: Maybe if we drill into some specific occurrences, we'll get a clue.
trans-unit.target: Maybe if we drill into some specific occurrences, we'll get a clue.

trans-unit.source: The custom events received from the app are listed by name on the overview blade:
trans-unit.target: The custom events received from the app are listed by name on the overview blade:

trans-unit.source: On the Overview blade, click one of the custom event types.
trans-unit.target: On the Overview blade, click one of the custom event types.

trans-unit.source: Click through the event of interest, and select a recent specific occurrence:
trans-unit.target: Click through the event of interest, and select a recent specific occurrence:

trans-unit.source: In the list under the summary chart, click an event
trans-unit.target: In the list under the summary chart, click an event

trans-unit.source: Let's look at all the telemetry for the session in which that particular NoGame event occurred.
trans-unit.target: Let's look at all the telemetry for the session in which that particular NoGame event occurred.

trans-unit.source: Click 'all telemetry for session'
trans-unit.target: Click 'all telemetry for session'

trans-unit.source: There were no exceptions, so the user wasn't prevented from playing by some failure.
trans-unit.target: There were no exceptions, so the user wasn't prevented from playing by some failure.

trans-unit.source: We can filter out all types of telemetry except page views for this session:
trans-unit.target: We can filter out all types of telemetry except page views for this session:

trans-unit.source: And now we can see that this user logged in simply to check the latest scores.
trans-unit.target: And now we can see that this user logged in simply to check the latest scores.

trans-unit.source: Maybe we should consider developing a user story that makes it easier to do that.
trans-unit.target: Maybe we should consider developing a user story that makes it easier to do that.

trans-unit.source: (And we should implement a custom event to report when this specific story occurs.)
trans-unit.target: (And we should implement a custom event to report when this specific story occurs.)

trans-unit.source: Filter, search and segment your data with properties
trans-unit.target: Filter, search and segment your data with properties

trans-unit.source: You can attach arbitrary tags and numeric values to events.
trans-unit.target: You can attach arbitrary tags and numeric values to events.

trans-unit.source: JavaScript at client
trans-unit.target: JavaScript at client

trans-unit.source: C# at server
trans-unit.target: C# at server

trans-unit.source: VB at server
trans-unit.target: VB at server

trans-unit.source: Attach properties to page views in the same way:
trans-unit.target: Attach properties to page views in the same way:

trans-unit.source: JavaScript at client
trans-unit.target: JavaScript at client

trans-unit.source: In Diagnostic Search, view the properties by clicking through an individual occurrence of an event.
trans-unit.target: In Diagnostic Search, view the properties by clicking through an individual occurrence of an event.

trans-unit.source: In the list of events, open an event, and then click '...'
trans-unit.target: In the list of events, open an event, and then click '...'

trans-unit.source: to see more properties
trans-unit.target: to see more properties

trans-unit.source: Use the Search field to see event occurrences with a particular property value.
trans-unit.target: Use the Search field to see event occurrences with a particular property value.

trans-unit.source: Type a value into the Search field
trans-unit.target: Type a value into the Search field

trans-unit.source: A | B Testing
trans-unit.target: A | B Testing

trans-unit.source: If you don't know which variant of a feature will be more successful, release both of them, making each accessible to different users.
trans-unit.target: If you don't know which variant of a feature will be more successful, release both of them, making each accessible to different users.

trans-unit.source: Measure the success of each, and then move to a unified version.
trans-unit.target: Measure the success of each, and then move to a unified version.

trans-unit.source: For this technique, you attach distinct tags to all the telemetry that is sent by each version of your app.
trans-unit.target: For this technique, you attach distinct tags to all the telemetry that is sent by each version of your app.

trans-unit.source: You can do that by defining properties in the active TelemetryContext.
trans-unit.target: You can do that by defining properties in the active TelemetryContext.

trans-unit.source: These default properties are added to every telemetry message that the application sends - not just your custom messages, but the standard telemetry as well.
trans-unit.target: These default properties are added to every telemetry message that the application sends - not just your custom messages, but the standard telemetry as well.

trans-unit.source: In the Application Insights portal, you'll then be able to filter and group (segment) your data on the tags, so as to compare the different versions.
trans-unit.target: In the Application Insights portal, you'll then be able to filter and group (segment) your data on the tags, so as to compare the different versions.

trans-unit.source: C# at server
trans-unit.target: C# at server

trans-unit.source: VB at server
trans-unit.target: VB at server

trans-unit.source: Individual telemetry can override the default values.
trans-unit.target: Individual telemetry can override the default values.

trans-unit.source: You can set up a universal initializer so that all new TelemetryClients automatically use your context.
trans-unit.target: You can set up a universal initializer so that all new TelemetryClients automatically use your context.

trans-unit.source: In the app initializer such as Global.asax.cs:
trans-unit.target: In the app initializer such as Global.asax.cs:

trans-unit.source: Build - Measure - Learn
trans-unit.target: Build - Measure - Learn

trans-unit.source: When you use analytics, it becomes an integrated part of your development cycle - not just something you think about to help solve problems.
trans-unit.target: When you use analytics, it becomes an integrated part of your development cycle - not just something you think about to help solve problems.

trans-unit.source: Here are some tips:
trans-unit.target: Here are some tips:

trans-unit.source: Determine the key metric of your application.
trans-unit.target: Determine the key metric of your application.

trans-unit.source: Do you want as many users as possible, or would you prefer a small set of very happy users?
trans-unit.target: Do you want as many users as possible, or would you prefer a small set of very happy users?

trans-unit.source: Do you want to maximize visits or sales?
trans-unit.target: Do you want to maximize visits or sales?

trans-unit.source: Plan to measure each story.
trans-unit.target: Plan to measure each story.

trans-unit.source: When you sketch a new user story or feature, or plan to update an existing one, always think about how you will measure the success of the change.
trans-unit.target: When you sketch a new user story or feature, or plan to update an existing one, always think about how you will measure the success of the change.

trans-unit.source: Before coding starts, ask "What effect will this have on our metrics, if it works?
trans-unit.target: Before coding starts, ask "What effect will this have on our metrics, if it works?

trans-unit.source: Should we track any new events?"
trans-unit.target: Should we track any new events?"

trans-unit.source: And of course, when the feature is live, make sure you look at the analytics and act on the results.
trans-unit.target: And of course, when the feature is live, make sure you look at the analytics and act on the results.

trans-unit.source: Relate other metrics to the key metric.
trans-unit.target: Relate other metrics to the key metric.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you add a 'favorites' feature, you'd like to know how often users add favorites.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you add a 'favorites' feature, you'd like to know how often users add favorites.

trans-unit.source: But it's perhaps more interesting to know how often they come back to their favorites.
trans-unit.target: But it's perhaps more interesting to know how often they come back to their favorites.

trans-unit.source: And, most importantly, do customers who use favorites ultimately buy more of your product?
trans-unit.target: And, most importantly, do customers who use favorites ultimately buy more of your product?

trans-unit.source: Canary testing.
trans-unit.target: Canary testing.

trans-unit.source: Set up a feature switch that allows you to make a new feature visible only to some users.
trans-unit.target: Set up a feature switch that allows you to make a new feature visible only to some users.

trans-unit.source: Use Application Insights to see whether the new feature is being used in the way you envisaged.
trans-unit.target: Use Application Insights to see whether the new feature is being used in the way you envisaged.

trans-unit.source: Make adjustments, then release it to a wider audience.
trans-unit.target: Make adjustments, then release it to a wider audience.

trans-unit.source: Talk to your users!
trans-unit.target: Talk to your users!

trans-unit.source: Analytics is not enough on its own, but complementary to maintaining a good customer relationship.
trans-unit.target: Analytics is not enough on its own, but complementary to maintaining a good customer relationship.

trans-unit.source: Learn more
trans-unit.target: Learn more

trans-unit.source: Detect, triage and diagnose crashes and performance issues in your app
trans-unit.target: Detect, triage and diagnose crashes and performance issues in your app

trans-unit.source: Get started with Application Insights on many platforms
trans-unit.target: Get started with Application Insights on many platforms

trans-unit.source: Video
trans-unit.target: Video

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
